Lecture 1

10 Nov 2016

Remember that the course will take place at 23.S01

General Idea

In this lecture we will introduce the basic concepts for the GIS analysis. Additionally, we will discuss the different GIS tools.

Slides

Basic Material used for the presentation

  • Fotheringham, A. S., Brunsdon, C., & Charlton, M. (2000). Quantitative Geography. SAGE.
  • Westra, E. (2010). Python Geospatial Development. Packt Publishing Ltd.
  • Lawhead, J. (2013). Learning Geospatial Analysis with Python. Packt Publishing Ltd.

Main Articles Cited during the presentation

  • Fujita M, Krugman P, Venables A J. The Spatial Economy: Cities, Regions, and International Trade. Cambridge:MIT,1999.
  • Dave Donaldson and Adam Storeygard, (2016).
  • (Vernon Henderson, J.; Storeygard, A. and Weil, D 2012)
  • Henderson et al (2012),
  • Pinkovskiy & Sala-i-Martin (2016),
  • Hodler & Raschky (2014),
  • Alesina et al (2016)
  • Nunn (2008)
  • Nunn & Wantchekon (2011),
  • Michalopoulos & Papaioannou (2013, 2014, 2015)
  • Alsan (2015)
  • Alesina et al. (2016)
  • (Duranton, D. and Overman, H 2005)
  • LSMS-ISA (World Bank) -> geo-coded household level 6 African countries
  • Gibbons, S. and Machin, S (2005)
  • Conley & Udry (2010)
  • Acemoglu, D; Garcia-Jimeno, C. and Robinson (2014)
  • Nunn (2008)
  • Dell (2010)

Other lectures based on ArcGIS

  • Melissa Dell (Harvard University) - GIS For Applied Economists
  • Masayuki Kudamatsu (Osaka University) - ArcGIS 10 for Economics Research
